alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 7:05AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Windsor County through 800 AM EDT... At 703 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of training thunderstorms near Cavendish, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Rainfall rates up to 0.75 inches per hour. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chester, Hartland Four Corners, Windsor, Cavendish, Andover, Perkinsville Village, Ascutney, Hartland, Baltimore, Springfield, Weathersfield, West Windsor, Hartford, Ludlow, Reading, Weston, Perkinsville, Felchville, Brownsville and North Hartland Dam Recreation Area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 near mile marker 1. Interstate 91 between mile markers 40 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
